intro: Coccoloba plantaginea, commonly known as the broadleaf prickly pear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its large, waxy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often forming dense thickets. The plant is also known for its ability to withstand salt spray and drought conditions.
